person.persName: John G. Holloway (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Holloway and Anne Starling Holloway. Married to Sarah R. Terry Holloway on April 1, 1830. Married to Laura M. Smith Holloway on September 4, 1838. Father of Peter Smith Holloway, John J. Holloway, William Starling Holloway, Ann R. Holloway, Edmund Starling Holloway, Laura A. Holloway, Hamden S. Holloway, James W. Holloway, Mary Turpen Holloway, and Robert Anderson Holloway. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky. Elected vice president of the Kentucky Colonization Society in 1847. Farmer in Henderson County 1850. Owned thirty-seven enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned fifty-two enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860, including Lety Mumford.
